ETYMOLOGY: From Old French sengle, from Latin singulus 'individual, single, separate'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not married or in a stable romantic relationship.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She has been single for five years since her last breakup.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 自从上次分手后，她已经单身五年了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Only one; not one of several.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There wasn't a single cloud in the sky.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Designed, intended, or suitable for one person or item.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 供一人用的；单人的；单件的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I booked a single room at the hotel for my business trip.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我为我的商务旅行在酒店订了一间单人房。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A recording of one song, especially one released separately from an album.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Her new single is expected to top the charts next week.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她的新单曲预计下周将登上榜首。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To choose someone or something from a group for special attention or treatment, often negative.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从群体中选出（某人或某物）；点名批评/表扬
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The teacher singled out Maria for her excellent essay.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 老师点名表扬了玛丽亚，因为她的论文写得非常出色。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Baseball) A hit which allows the batter to reach first base safely. (Cricket) A run scored by hitting the ball and running between the wickets once. (Tennis) A game played with one player on each side.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (棒球) 一垒安打；(板球) 一分击球跑；(网球) 单打
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He hit a single in the bottom of the ninth inning to load the bases.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他在第九局下半打出了一垒安打，满垒了。
